main event: A graduate student observed a yellowish-white circular object moving in a straight line over Charlottesville, Virginia on October 6, 1962.
interesting points: The object was observed for 3-4 minutes before disappearing., It moved silently and left no visible trail., The student used binoculars to view the object, which appeared as a point source of light., The object made a sharp turn and moved at a faster speed before becoming stationary for 30 seconds., There were no witnesses to the observation, making it an isolated report.
witness description: a graduate student from the University of Virginia
